content.description: This climbs the gently overhanging wall on juggy holds, then traverses slightly up and right to a technical finish on small holds up past the 6th bolt.
content.location: Straight up the center of the prominent wall of Sector Clyde (see pic).

content.description:
Lots of fun moves, but the crux move is significantly harder (perhaps a bit reachy).

Up 2-ft-deep R-facing corner to 2-ft-deep roof. Right under roof five feet and up into 1-ft-deep R-facing corner. Up this (crux) to its top.

name: On the giant pillar of the Grand Capucin overlooking the glacier at Cirque Maudit in the Mont Blanc massif ... the upper pitches of the route

O Sole Mio

are often used as an alternate (interesting but less difficult) finish for the ultra-classic alpine rock route

Voie des Suisses

.

warning

: The rock in this sector has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.
content.protection:
No fixed hardware for top anchor or for leading.

Protection for Trad leading is unknown.

Top-Roping: Straightforward to reach obvious tree anchor on diagonal ramp at top of wall, by hiking up to ramp way around its left side, then scramble up that to big tree at outside edge of ramp.
content.location:
On left side of main lower wall, 15 ft right from big R-facing corner on the right side of large block with short steep trail section alongside, which has a 25-ft-high rectangular face on its downhill (southeast) side.

- - >

See on this Photo

. . . .

or on this Photo

content.description:
Fun moves. Too bad it's not longer.

Up the rectangular face on the downhill (right) side of the block.

warning

: The rock in this sector has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.
content.protection:
No fixed hardware for top anchor or for leading.

Protection for Trad leading is unknown.

Top-Roping: Easy to hike up onto top of block. Should be possible to build some sort of natural or Trad anchor, likely need a static line or some long slings, perhaps Trad cams or stoppers.
content.location:
On a large block with short steep trail section alongside, which has a 25-ft-high rectangular face on its downhill (southeast) side.

- - >

See on this Photo

. . . .

or on this Photo

content.description:
Interesting moves. Too bad it's not longer.

Start up a 2-ft-deep Right-facing corner for about ten ft, then diagonal Left up ramp. Navigate to top.

warning

: The rock in this sector has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.
